Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to declare family member under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether an applicant excluded under paragraph 117(9)(d) can seek judicial review without exhausting IAD appeal rights
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review application following refusal of sponsorship
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Paragraph 117(9)(d) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Exclusion from family class due to non-declaration
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Jurisdictional compliance with statutory appeal scheme
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Mandatory exhaustion of IAD appeal rights before judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to declare family member prior to sponsorâ€™s permanent residency
Crimes.Application_Factor: Non-accompanying family member not declared at time of entry
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: No relief granted; must appeal to IAD first
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Availability of judicial review despite exclusion
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Spouse failed to declare Seshaw as family member
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Applicant must use available appeal process
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration decisions

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Federal Court can review a refusal of humanitarian and compassionate grounds when excluded from family class
Crimes.Application_Facts: Seshaw was excluded under paragraph 117(9)(d) due to non-declaration by spouse
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Federal Court lacks jurisdiction until IAD appeal is exhausted
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Insufficient humanitarian and compassionate grounds found by officer
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to appeal to IAD before seeking judicial review
Crimes.Application_Basis: Refusal based on failure to meet H&C thresholds
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Overturn refusal of permanent residence application
Crimes.Cause_Description: Spouse did not declare Seshaw upon entry
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer considered but found insufficient H&C factors
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Lack of jurisdiction due to unexhausted appeals
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer assessed but did not find sufficient hardship
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Statutory bar to judicial review without IAD appeal
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Exhaustion of appeal rights under IRPA

Crimes.Crime_Name: Humanitarian and Compassionate consideration refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Violation_Type: Refusal of humanitarian and compassionate application
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Federal Court can hear a judicial review when the applicant is excluded from the family class
Crimes.Application_Facts: Seshaw was excluded because his spouse did not declare him before obtaining PR
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of refusal based on H&C grounds
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Federal Court lacks jurisdiction; IAD appeal required first
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Inadmissible family member due to non-declaration
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Immigration officer denied H&C relief citing regulatory exclusion
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Strength of humanitarian and compassionate factors
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Premature judicial review without IAD appeal
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Affidavits, family relationship documents, hardship evidence
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for exemption based on H&C grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Family unity, best interests of child, establishment in Canada
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Overturn refusal and allow permanent residence
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Family separation, emotional and financial hardship
Crimes.Cause_Description: Failure to declare and insufficient H&C grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer reviewed but did not find grounds to waive exclusion
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliance with family class inclusion rules
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Lack of jurisdiction due to unexhausted IAD appeal
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Balanced H&C factors but found exclusion mandatory
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Only IAD has authority to hear such appeals initially

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Sponsor ineligibility due to financial obligation
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether judicial review is available when sponsor is ineligible due to loan default and applicant is excluded from family class
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Loan default status verified by immigration authorities
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate eligibility or exception
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Sponsors must not be in default of immigration loans
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to exhaust IAD appeal rights
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached due to procedural bar
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Applicant must pursue IAD appeal first
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Seeking judicial review despite procedural bar
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Application refused due to sponsor ineligibility and exclusion
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Appeal to IAD required before judicial review
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section related to sponsor ineligibility due to debt
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Relevant provisions on sponsor obligations and defaults
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Sponsor ineligibility due to loan default
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Federal Court jurisdiction limited by statute
